definition: to ramble/to rove/old variant of 熬[ao2]
to turn up one's nose/to show disdain for/to regard superciliously
to be inordinately proud of one's ability/to be conceited and contemptuous (idiom)
satisfied with one's accomplishment and arrogant as a result (idiom); resting on one's laurels and despising others

sentences.english: Cantonese restaurants take pride in their enormous fish tanks.
sentences.chinese: 廣東菜館以有大量的魚爲傲。

sentences.english: These people are actually proud to cancel their cable TV service.
sentences.chinese: 這些人事實上已經以退掉有線電視服務爲傲。

sentences.english: We take as much pride in our ultra-modern aircraft as we do in our old-fashioned ideas about service.
sentences.chinese: 我們以超現代化飛機爲傲，也以傳統的服務理念爲傲。

sentences.english: We take as much pride in our ultra-modern aircraft as we do in our old-fashioned ideas about service.
sentences.chinese: 我們以超現代化飛機爲傲，也以傳統的服務理念爲傲。

sentences.english: Let your kids know you are proud of them.
sentences.chinese: 讓你的孩子知道你以他們爲傲。

sentences.english: The ionisation radiation has to each arrogant living thing eliminates the function.
sentences.chinese: 電離輻射對各種傲生物都有殺滅作用。

sentences.english: The noble took pride in his genealogy.
sentences.chinese: 該位貴族以自己的血統爲傲。

sentences.english: I wish I were this eagle, for he struggled to achieve and take pride.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望自己就是這奮發向上並以此爲傲的鷹。

sentences.english: Still, it is commonly in the blend of pine trees.
sentences.chinese: 靜，是松樹一般傲立於世的品格。

sentences.english: The proud and arrogant man-"Mocker" is his name; he behaves with overweening pride.
sentences.chinese: 心驕氣傲的人，名叫褻慢，他行事狂妄，都出於驕傲。

sentences.english: This village has its own traditional dress, cuisine, folklore and handicrafts.
sentences.chinese: 露西以她高超的烹調手藝爲傲，這是情有可原的。

definition: to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat
Lingyun county in Baise 百色[Bai3 se4], Guangxi
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
